summary: Build a Valentine proposal single-page website (React/Tailwind) with updated theme styling (include pink), include an additional user-provided photo asset, and adjust the ‚ÄúNO‚Äù interaction to show cute messages only (no GIF).

existing_features.title: Implement a single-page Valentine proposal experience in the React frontend that matches the provided HTML/CSS/JS layout and copy: full-viewport pink/red gradient background, centered white rounded card, top image, emoji row, heading ‚ÄúHey Saesha üíñ‚Äù, proposal paragraph, and two buttons ‚ÄúYES üíï‚Äù and ‚ÄúNO üôà‚Äù.

Recreate the ‚ÄúNO‚Äù button playful interaction: when the user hovers over or clicks the NO button, it moves to a random nearby position and the main text area updates by cycling through the provided funny lines, including embedding the provided GIF URL.
Recreate the ‚ÄúYES‚Äù button success state: clicking YES replaces the card content with the provided celebration emojis, heading, and message ending with ‚ÄúForever yours, Varun ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äù.

Add the top card image as a static frontend asset named exactly "saesha.jpg" and render it with the same presentation (full width, rounded corners). If the image file is not present, show a graceful fallback placeholder area without breaking layout.

Use a coherent romantic visual theme consistent with the provided snippet (warm pink/red gradient, rounded card, soft shadows, modern friendly typography) and apply it consistently using the project‚Äôs Tailwind + component styling conventions.

Add the user-uploaded photo(s) as static frontend assets and display an additional photo inside the main card layout (in addition to the existing /saesha.jpg image), without breaking the current image fallback behavior.

Change the site‚Äôs visual theme from the current Valentine pink/red gradient look to a new coherent theme (colors, gradients, shadows, and typography), and apply it consistently across the page and buttons while keeping the existing overall layout and interactions intact.

Remove the embedded GIF from the ‚ÄúNO‚Äù button interaction and replace the reaction area with a cycle of cute, English-only messages (no GIFs, no external media), while keeping the NO button‚Äôs playful movement behavior.

Update the app‚Äôs visual theme to prominently use pink (instead of the current ocean blue/teal theme) across the full-page background gradient, headings, and primary button styling, while keeping the existing layout and YES/NO interactions unchanged.

Replace any remaining ocean/blue/teal theme tokens used by the proposal UI with the new pink theme tokens, including fallback placeholder gradients for missing images, so the page looks consistently pink-themed.

Add a simple in-page photo upload control that lets the user add/replace the smaller photo tiles shown under the main "/saesha.jpg" image, using local-only browser previews (no backend storage). The uploaded images must display immediately in the existing grid layout and keep the current graceful fallback placeholders when no image is provided or a preview is cleared.

Remove or gate the currently hardcoded extra photo filenames (e.g., "/IMG-20260208-WA0005.jpg", "/IMG-20260208-WA0005-1.jpg") so the UI does not rely on unknown files being present in production; default to placeholders unless the user uploads photos or the assets are explicitly present.

Add the uploaded image file "IMG-20260208-WA0005-3.jpg" as a static frontend asset and display it in the proposal card‚Äôs photo grid (the two smaller photo tiles under "/saesha.jpg") as a default photo when no local upload preview is present, without breaking the existing local-only upload/replace behavior and placeholder fallbacks.

Add the two newly uploaded images as static frontend assets (IMG-20260208-WA0008.jpg and IMG-20260208-WA0010.jpg) and render them inside the existing proposal card photo area, without breaking the current main image (/saesha.jpg) rendering, the existing two-tile upload/preview behavior, or any current graceful placeholder fallbacks.

Update the proposal card photo grid in frontend/src/App.tsx to display these 3 new static photos as the three smaller photo tiles under /saesha.jpg, and remove the current dependency on local upload previews for those tiles.

Remove the in-page ‚ÄúAdd photos/Replace photos‚Äù upload control from the proposal page UI, including the hidden file input, upload/clear buttons, and any related state/hooks that are only used for local photo uploads.

Keep the existing proposal page layout and interactions intact, but update the photo grid under the main /saesha.jpg image to display all 6 newly uploaded images as the smaller tiles (same grid style/spacing/rounded corners). Use a 2-column grid with 3 rows of small tiles under the main image (main image still spans both columns).

Remove the in-page local photo upload functionality and its UI/state from the proposal page now that the grid is fully static: remove the hidden <input type="file"> element, the "Add photos/Replace photos" button, the clear button, and any related local preview state usage in frontend/src/App.tsx. If the local preview hook is no longer used anywhere, remove its import/usage and clean up any now-unused code.

Preserve graceful fallback behavior for missing images: if any of the static photo assets (including /saesha.jpg) fail to load, render a visually consistent pink-themed placeholder tile that does not break the grid layout.
